text: I think they removed FormData from serverless functions and thats why this is all erroring out now
if you're lucky enough to have a instance from before itll work but good luck trying to get a new instance approved - i'm up to 2+ days of waiting
did some testing, seems fordata is accesible but is bugging out or something? its weird
<@UCBDLK6SU> I tried wrapping it in a try catch, but still nothing. Thereâ€™s also no errors on the private apps page. Where/how can I see the error?
I think its just generally fd Dustin right now
when I hear back from HubSpot i'll let ya know
trying a few things on my end

Updating a serverlesss function secret for a account via the CLI and get this message:

```Make sure to `upload` all serverless functions using this secret to access its new value.```
What does this mean and how do you "upload" functions created through the Design Manager?
this seemed to have killed all my functions that use any kind of secret at all, so I guess beware?

Hi, guys.
I encountered a big problem while using serverless functions.
So I came to see my friends.

I want to use serverless functions on my blog post detail page.

When I conducted the test, I checked that the data in the hubDB was imported well.

But when a blog post is written, I want the data to be updated in the hubDB.

Here's the problem.

The domain of the site and the domain of the page where you write the blog post are different. As a result, CORS is occurring.

For example, the domain I use is: <https://xxxx.com>...
The blog post creation page domain is: <https://app.HubSpot.com/>

I know it's a simple problem to solve if you have a server outside.
But honestly, I have serverless functions and I don't want to have an external server, and I want to know if I can solve this problem.

If you have friends who know the solution, please let me know.
Look into a CORS Anywhere server
Thank you for your answer. I don't want to have a server in the middle. I only want to use serverless functions.
try setting the cors request to ignore it I guess then

I've already read about serverless fountains.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions/reference>

My problem is that the domains are different, and there is no way to solve it with settings anymore.
So I wrote this because I was curious about what other solutions would be.
I dunno who to tag about this but apparently if you update a HS secret via the CLI, any function that is made through the Design Manager will break and _not_ be able to use secrets anymore.
So my issue seems to be that HubSpot serverless functions can't support turning a arraybuffer into a blob

More on this: It appears its not even the arraybuffer, its when you attempt to append to the FormData within the serverless it throws:

```Execution Time: 2283msRuntime.UnhandledPromiseRejection: TypeError: source.on is not a function```
very odd
<@U03MLCLS5BN> i'm copying carter and putting you in for this also - this is breaking any serverless functions that are created via the UI
